SENT.plain: Vascular Early Response Gene (Verge) is an immediate early gene (IEG) that is up-regulated in endothelial cells in response to a number of stressors, including ischemic stroke
Endothelial cell lines that stably express Verge show enhanced permeability
Increased Verge expression has also been associated with blood brain barrier breakdown
In this study we investigated the role of Verge in ischemic injury induced by middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO) in both Verge knockout (KO) and wild type (WT) mice
Verge KO mice had significantly less cerebral edema formation after MCAO compared to WT mice
However, stroke outcome (infarct size and neurological deficit scores) evaluated at either 24 or 72 hours after stroke showed no differences between the two genotypes
Verge deletion leads to decreased edema formation after ischemia; however acute stroke outcomes were unchanged
